main_definition: Hand is a part of the human body, specifically the end part consisting of fingers and the palm; it's also used as an idiom in English language to convey various meanings.

meanings_and_examples.example: He offered his hand to help the elderly woman cross the street.

meanings_and_examples.definition: An amount of work given by a person
meanings_and_examples.example: The teacher gave us a hand with the complex math problems.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To take control or responsibility for something
meanings_and_examples.example: I will handle this project myself; I'll take it into my own hands.

meanings_and_examples.definition: A unit of weight (in certain contexts)
meanings_and_examples.example: The recipe calls for one handful of flour.

meanings_and_examples.definition: An object that can be held
meanings_and_examples.example: This pen is designed to be easy to hold and write with.
